main event: Observers reported a bright white object, as large as two full moons, that illuminated the entire area. It was hovering at about six blocks away and 30 feet above the ground.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a silvery or silvery-gray metallic sphere or oval-shaped object that was illuminated from within, producing a glow or halo around it.
The object moved with a smooth, gliding motion and showed no visible signs of propulsion.
The observer estimated the object to be slightly larger than a softball and at a distance of around 1,500 feet.
The object was observed for about 1 minute.
Other details in the report include the object appearing solid, with sharply outlined edges, and it did not make any sound.
